newsitem.title: GREECE: ALPHA CREDIT BANK KEEPS PRIME RATE AT 15.50PCT.
newsitem.headline: ALPHA CREDIT BANK KEEPS PRIME RATE AT 15.50PCT.

text.p: Greece's Alpha Credit Bank said its prime rate for working capital and fixed asset loans will be unchanged at 15.50 percent.
Alpha Credit, which reviews its rates weekly, said the maximum add-on would remain unchanged at 3.5 percent.

Its adjustable-rate mortgages will be set at 15.75 percent from 17 percent. The bank launched 15-year mortgages in October 1995 with rates set at 12.0 percent for the first five years. Rates on these loans will be reduced to 11.50 percent today from 11.75 percent.
